attributes.action: Resolve conflict between company & charity law & data protection act which deters people from being Trustees of an incorporated Charity
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
By company law, director’s details are published by HMG companies house, with NO control on access, use or sale of personal data [full name DoB current/previous address]

If, for personal security or professional boundaries with vulnerable clients, they use a service address, they must pay £100 to request this & even if the Police agree, historical records are NOT removed-remaining in the public domain.

Companies House admit this is totally ineffective, a bad joke.

Many become charity trustees knowing that HMG charity commission will NOT reveal their address.

Many charities incorporate as a limited company, so trustees become company directors, their details become public records-which can NEVER be removed even after £100 payment & police risk assessment!

This encourages identity theft, DETERS people from being Trustees, makes a mockery of the law, the DPA, HMG - their commitment to voluntary & community sector & personal privacy.
